item.title: CV
item.description:
Last modified: April 2025
Download PDF

Professional Appointments

  • 2020–present - Assistant Professor, Faculty of Philology, Vilnius University
  • 2019–2020 - Junior Assistant, Faculty of Philology, Vilnius University
  • 2016–2018 - Teaching Fellow, Department of English, University of California, Los Angeles

Education

  • 2020 - PhD, English, University of California, Los Angeles
    • Dissertation: “Literature and the Production of Geography in Nineteenth-Century America”
    • Committee: Christopher J. Looby (chair); John Agnew; Michael C. Cohen; Sarah Tindal Kareem
  • 2014 - MA, English, University of California, Los Angeles
  • 2010 - BA with High Distinction, English, University of Virginia

Awards, Fellowships & Honors

  • 2017 - Emily Dickinson International Society Critical Institute Keynote Award (EDIS)
  • 2017–2018 - UCLA English Department Dissertation Year Fellowship
  • 2016 - Departmental Conference Travel Award (UCLA)
  • 2014–2015 - Mellon Foundation Graduate Pedagogy Working Group and Fellowship (UCLA)
  • 2014 - Departmental Summer Research Grant (UCLA)
  • 2013 - Fred and Edith Herman Memorial Poetry Prize, Academy of American Poets
  • 2012 - Graduate Summer Research Mentorship with Christopher Looby (UCLA)
  • 2011 - UCLA University Fellowship

Publications

Book Chapters

  • “Dickinson’s Geographic Poetics,” in The New Emily Dickinson Studies, ed. Michelle Kohler. Cambridge: Cambridge University Press (2019).

Reviews

  • “Review of Whitman & Dickinson: A Colloquy, ed. Éric Athenot and Cristanne Miller.” Women’s Studies: An Interdisciplinary Journal 47, no. 3 (April 2018).
  • “Review of Excursions with Thoreau: Philosophy, Poetry, Religion, by Edward F. Mooney.” Thoreau Society Bulletin (Spring 2017).

Conferences

Keynote

  • “Dickinson’s Interiors: A Theory of Authorship in the Todd Correspondence,” Emily Dickinson International Society Annual Meeting, Amherst, Massachusetts. Aug 11-12, 2017.

Panelist

  • “Bridging Cultures: The Power of Multilingualism in a Globalized World.” European Day of Languages Panel Discussion. Faculty of Philology, Vilnius University. September 26, 2024.
  • “Beyond Listening and Speaking: The Role of Writing in Fostering Critical Thought in Literature Students.” Nurturing Critical Minds: Interdisciplinary Perspectives in Education and the Workforce. Vilnius University. June 27-28, 2024.
  • “Charles Brockden Brown’s Magazines and the Birth of Critical Geography.” British Association for American Studies Annual Meeting. April 6-11, 2021.
  • “Emily Dickinson’s Narrative Cartography,” MLA Convention. New York City. Jan 4-7, 2018.
  • “Are not those your / Countrymen?”: Dickinson’s Defense in the Higginson Letters," Emily Dickinson International Society Annual Meeting. Paris. June 24-26, 2016.
  • “‘Tumultuous Privacy’: Spatial Poetics and Dickinson’s Late Epistolarity.” Dickinson Institute Workshop. Emily Dickinson International Society Annual Meeting, Amherst, Massachusetts. Aug 7, 2015.
  • “Invocations of America: Space, Place, and Imagination in James Boswell’s Hebrides Journal.” PAMLA Annual Convention. University of California, Riverside. Nov 1-2, 2014.
  • “Post- and Trans-Human Bodies.” Panel respondent. Southland/Friends of English Graduate Conference, UCLA. May 30, 2014.

Teaching

Master’s (Vilnius University)

2022-present - Authorship and “the Author Question” in Literary Discourse
2021 - Graduate Research Paper Writing (with Linara Bartkuvienė and Rūta Šlapkauskaitė)

item.title: localauthor
item.description: Occasional short sketches on local fare and otherwise, offered freely.

item.title: poem-machine
item.description:
Turning your favorite source text into the stock of your creations one random word at a time.

Command-line version: https://github.com/localauthor/poem-machine

item.title: poem-machine-crawl
item.description:
Wonder at the infinite crawl of the poem-machine.

Currently Serving Up:

  • Dickinson’s Poems (1890)
  • Thoreau’s Journal
  • Fuller’s Summer on the Lakes (1844)

Some reports from the machine: https://localauthor.github.io/poem-machine-poems

Or, visit the Github repository, to see the source code: https://github.com/localauthor/poem-machine-crawl

item.title: Poetry Society Meetings
item.description:
• Emily Dickinson - December 15, 2022 (Grant)
  • Philip Larkin pt. 1 - February 1, 2023 (Davide and Kristina)
  • Philip Larkin pt. 2 - March 8, 2023 (Davide)
  • W.B. Yeats - April 13, 2023 (Kristina)
  • T.S. Eliot - May 11, 2023 (Manuel)
  • Walt Whitman - May 31, 2023 (Whitman’s birthday!) (Grant)
  • Wallace Stevens - July 17, 2023 (Deividas)
  • Seamus Heaney (sumuštinis) - September 28, 2023 (Davide)
  • [Cemetery Reading - November 1, 2023]
  • Sylvia Plath - December 6, 2023 (Kamilė)
  • [Christmas Dinner - December 16, 2023]
  • Emily Brontė - February 29, 2024 (Kristina)
  • John Keats - March 28, 2024 (Deividas)
  • Adrienne Rich - May 3, 2024 (Kamilė)
  • Marianne Moore - June 1, 2024 (Davide)
  • W.H. Auden - September 8, 2024 (Davide)
  • Natasha Trethewey - October 4, 2024 (Grant)
  • Elizabeth Bishop - November 2, 2024 (Grant and Kristina)
  • William Carlos Williams - February 7, 2025 (Davide)
  • Anne Sexton - March 7, 2025 (Manuel)
  • John Ashbery - June 6, 2025 (Davide)
  • Harlem Renaissance - October 3, 2025 (Ella)
  • Animals Rights Poetry - November 7, 2025 (Dario)
  • William Blake, The Marriage of Heaven and Hell - December 5, 2025 (Grant)
  • NEXT POET: Mary Oliver - January 9, 2026

item.title: zk
item.description:
Demacs package for taking notes using the Zettelkasten method.

  • Introduction and Key Features

  • Demo of setup and basic features

  • Demo of ‘Index’ and ‘Desktop’ interfaces
